Wisdom: الْمَوْتُ أَلْزَمُ لَكُمْ مِنْ ظِلِّكُمْ وَأَمْلَكُ بِكُمْ [لَكُمْ‏] مِنْ أَنْفُسِكُمْ
enWisdom: Death clings to you more closely than your own shadows and has greater authority over you than [you have over] yourselves

Wisdom: أَشَدُّ مِنَ الْمَوْتِ مَا يُتَمَنَّى الْخَلَاصُ مِنْهُ بِالْمَوْتِ [أَفْضَلُ تُحْفَةِ الْمَوْتِ أَشَدُّ مَا يُتَمَنَّى الْخَلَاصُ مِنْهُ بِالْمَوْتِ‏]
enWisdom: More severe than death is that which one seeks to be freed from through death

Wisdom: إِنَّ هَذَا الْمَوْتَ لَطَالِبٌ حَثِيثٌ لَا يَفُوتُهُ الْمُقِيمُ وَلَا يُعْجِزُهُ مَنْ هَرَبَ
enWisdom: Verily this death is a swift seeker neither does the steadfast escape it nor does the fleer frustrate it

Wisdom: إِنَّ عَلَيَّ مِنْ أَجَلِي جُنَّةً حَصِينَةً فَإِذَا جَاءَ يَوْمِي انْفَرَجَتْ عَنِّي وَأَسْلَمَتْنِي فَحِينَئِذٍ لَا يَطِيشُ السَّهْمُ وَلَا يَبْرَأُ الْكَلْمُ
enWisdom: Verily there is a shield over me, in the form of my appointed time of death, which protects me; so when my day comes, it relieves itself of me and surrenders me [to death]At this time the arrow will not miss its target and the wound will not heal

Wisdom: إِنَّكَ طَرِيدُ الْمَوْتِ الَّذِي لَا يَنْجُو هَارِبُهُ وَلَا بُدَّ أَنَّهُ مُدْرِكُهُ
enWisdom: Verily you are on the run from the death whose fleer is not saved and must eventually meet it

Wisdom: إِنَّكُمْ طُرَدَاءُ الْمَوْتِ الَّذِي إِنْ أَقَمْتُمْ أَخَذَكُمْ وَإِنْ فَرَرْتُمْ مِنْهُ أَدْرَكَكُمْ
enWisdom: Verily you are all running away from the death which will take you if you remain steadfast [to resist it] and will catch up with you if you [try to] flee
For every appointed time there is an arrival
There is no protector for one who is sought by Allah [for punishment]

Wisdom: لَوْ أَنَّ الْمَوْتَ يُشْتَرَى لَاشْتَرَاهُ الْأَغْنِيَاءُ
enWisdom: If death could be bought, the affluent would have surely bought it

Wisdom: مَنْ دَنَا مِنْهُ أَجَلُهُ لَمْ تُعِنْهُ [لم تعننه‏] حِيَلُهُ
enWisdom: One whose death draws near to him cannot be saved [from it] by his efforts

Wisdom: مَنْ وُكِّلَ بِهِ الْمَوْتُ اجْتَاحَهُ وَأَفْنَاهُ
enWisdom: Whoever has [the angel of] death given charge over him, is overrun and annihilated by it

Wisdom: مَا يَنْجُو مِنَ الْمَوْتِ مَنْ طَلَبَهُ
enWisdom: One who is sought by death cannot be saved from it

Wisdom: هَلْ يَدْفَعُ عَنْكُمُ الْأَقَارِبُ أَوْ تَنْفَعُكُمُ النَّوَاحِبُ
enWisdom: Can the near ones repel [death] from you, or can the wailing [of the women and children] be of any benefit to you?

Wisdom: هَلْ مِنْ خَلَاصٍ أَوْ مَنَاصٍ أَوْ مَلَاذٍ أَوْ مَعَاذٍ أَوْ فِرَارٍ أَوْ مَحَارٍ [أَوْ مَجَارٍ]
enWisdom: Do not persist in that which is followed by sin

Wisdom: هَيْهَاتَ أَنْ يَفُوتَ الْمَوْتُ مَنْ طَلَبَ أَوْ يَنْجُوَ مِنْهُ مَنْ هَرَبَ
enWisdom: Far be it for death to lose the one whom it seeks or for the one who flees it to get saved [from it]

Wisdom: لَا تَغْتَرَّنَّ بِالْأَمْنِ فَإِنَّكَ مَأْخُوذٌ مِنْ مَأْمَنِكَ
enWisdom: Do not be deceived by [a false sense of] security, for you will surely be taken from your sanctuary
There is no blame on the one who flees from his death
Death is a heedless watchman (or friend)
